rev.comment: seems to give undue weight to U3, counting the fact that any USB drive can use regular [[portable apps]]

Line 30: Line 30:
== Technology==
== Technology==
{{main|Flash memory|USB}}
{{main|Flash memory|USB}}
â
[[File:ToshibaUSB.jpg|thumb|left|Toshiba TransMemory Flash Drive with cover on. Comes pre-installed with [[U3]], allowing users to take their applications, fully installed and operational to most Windows desktops.]]
 
Flash memory combines a number of older technologies, with the low cost, low power consumption and small size made possible by {{As of|2008|alt=recent}} advances in [[microprocessor]] technology. The memory storage is based on earlier [[EPROM]] and [[EEPROM]] technologies. These had very limited capacity, were very slow for both reading and writing, required complex high-voltage drive circuitry, and could only be re-written after erasing the entire contents of the chip.
Flash memory combines a number of older technologies, with the low cost, low power consumption and small size made possible by {{As of|2008|alt=recent}} advances in [[microprocessor]] technology. The memory storage is based on earlier [[EPROM]] and [[EEPROM]] technologies. These had very limited capacity, were very slow for both reading and writing, required complex high-voltage drive circuitry, and could only be re-written after erasing the entire contents of the chip.
